website_summaries.verdict: Basic infant life jacket that's a good pick if you're on a budget and want something to have on hand.
pros: Does what it needs to do
Keeps the head above water and flips the baby to their back
Head cushion handle lets parents keep a good grip
cons: Big and bulky, making it uncomfortable for many babies

customer_reviews.title: NOT A LIFE JACKET!
customer_reviews.text: This is NOT a life jacket. It is a buoyancy device. Do not purchase this as a life preserver for a young child that cannot flip onto their back, or their face will be submerged in water with their backs up. We bought this by mistake, and the inside label says buoyancy device. That wasn’t in the description so I just wanted to make the buyers aware.
customer_reviews.author: Pen Name

customer_reviews.title: Not a real Stearns Vest! Knock off!
customer_reviews.text: Not a real Stearns vest! We got a knock off that says ‘not a life saving device’.... the description says it is US coast guard approved which this is clearly not. If it is real... it has the safety details on the inside of the back and the Stearns tag near the lower buckle. I am shocked this is “Amazon’s Choice”
customer_reviews.author: Monica

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't keep the head up
customer_reviews.text: Sadly, I found that our toddler kept flipping over onto her stomach when wearing this flotation device. Rather than keeping her head out of the water, it basically did the opposite. This is reportedly "coast guard approved", so not sure what to make of this. On the upside, was pretty easy to grab the strap at the top to keep her head up, but this design seems flawed when applied to real toddlers in real life.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for them playing in ocean and pool water
customer_reviews.text: We bought two of these for our 13 month old grandbabies to take on a boat. Worked great for them playing in ocean and pool water.
customer_reviews.author: John Curry

customer_reviews.title: Good life vest for a great value
customer_reviews.text: A lot of bad reviews I read said either this wasn't a legitimate Stearns product, not US Coast Guard Approved, or didn't allow their child to float on their backs. I think that either these people somehow didn't get the right product and should have probably returned it, or they just didn't read the documentation that came with the vest. This is a Type II Personal Floatation Device. There is a 16+ page booklet that goes over important information including fit, testing it out, teaching your kid how to float, the fact that you may need to try different styles if they can't float face up, etc. Seems very good quality and legitimate.
customer_reviews.author: Dalton Burns

customer_reviews.title: It works!!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for a six-month old so we could go out on the lake with him. We were canoeing when a sudden storm came up with such strong winds that we capsized. I think the best praise a life-vest can get is that it worked when put to the test. Of course there was a lot of crying, but the baby floated with his head above water. The grab pull at the top was useful as he was hauled into another boat. I am very thankful he was wearing it!
customer_reviews.author: anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my 5-month-old daughter on our lake days!! Can tighten up to fit snug, and she is quite petite. I love that she can grow in to it, as it will fit her until over a year old!
customer_reviews.author: Cristina Stirewalt

customer_reviews.title: Big vest but best we could find
customer_reviews.text: I have a petite 11 month old (16.5lbs, 27.5 inches) j bought he vest bc those of you with 3 month olds said it was the only one small enough for your very little ones. This vest is definitely a bit large but the little one did not complain. I really don't see how it could have fit our tiny human any better. Overall I would buy this again but I am also holding on to baby, otherwise vest rides up! My baby would tell you it's the best teether ever.
customer_reviews.author: A Prime Addict

customer_reviews.title: Printing for USCG seems legit (unlike other pics)
customer_reviews.text: I saw pics in here making me nervous about its legitimacy but ours seems to have all the normal printing inside. These types work well for our 6 month old. You cant, of course, ever leave your infant unattended in water so all these comments about their kid being able to flip over... give me a break! If your child us old enough to be on their tummy you would use those arm and front facing ones. ANYWAYS glad I ignored some of the reviews and went for it. This will be perfect for now at the local indoor pool and a good safety measure for boating in the summer.
customer_reviews.author: Wyk

customer_reviews.title: Put my son's face into the water!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in advance before our trip to the river and thankfully tested it out in a friends pool before. Thank goodness I did! We put my 16 month old son in it and the vest kept flipping him over, putting his face into the water. He only floated on his back for a few seconds after we placed him in that starting position. I waited too long to return and today was the dead line. My loss but he will NEVER wear this.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful
customer_reviews.text: I was scared at first based on other reviews. Some said they had "calm" babies that didn't want to be near the life jacket. WELL this little dude is 9 weeks old, and he did better than you can imagine! Day 1: wore it for 7 HOURS other than diaper changes. Day 2: wore it for 6 HOURS! There was ZERO crying from him while wearing the life preserver. He is a wonderful little boy! Made this family happy!
customer_reviews.author: beus

customer_reviews.title: Not for swimming, its for back floating
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for the pool for my 1 year old. Its not really handy because she cant swim while wearing it. Its more of a float on back type of life jacket. I put her in the pool with it and it works. She is able to float on her back. She doesnt look like shes javing fun but she doesnt get angry either. So im assuming shes ok with it, as she's very vocal about what she doesnt like. If your trying to buy this for swimming, dont. Other wise for floating and boating its perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Si

customer_reviews.title: Could easily drown in this
customer_reviews.text: If you’re planning on buying this for a pool, don’t. We bought it for a rambunctious 26lb 1 year old so he could have a little independence & we found it made him float upright on his back for about 5 seconds before he would naturally (without flailing) roll onto his side and then face down. For the zero entry pool it made it more difficult for him to stand up than if he’d been wearing nothing. More facedown.
customer_reviews.author: mccbe

customer_reviews.title: Fit our preemie
customer_reviews.text: Bought this life jacket for a 10 lb, 2 month old preemie. Fit well, not too loose. With baby's short neck the front poked the chin when we had the neck collar positioned above the jacket liked a pillow. We solved that problem by folding the neck collar down in the back (flat across shoulders and upper back) so that baby's back was laying on the neck collar.
customer_reviews.author: Barbie

customer_reviews.title: I did not trust it
customer_reviews.text: I bought the red vest, which at the time was $16.49. I was under the impression It was being sold by Stevens, however it was not. It took a long time to arrive, as it was coming from China, which I was also not aware of at the time. The size I ordered was infant, however the vest’s stag was labeled “S” and was much too large for an infant size. The logo on the front of the vest was pealing off. It was difficult to get a full refund.
customer_reviews.author: basso

customer_reviews.title: great with one exception
customer_reviews.text: Thank you for a great vest at a decent price. We have used this all summer. It did take a few times for my toddler to get used to wearing it, but he seems great with it now. The straps are nice and long, easily adjustable and it fits as expected. I definitely don't think I will let go of my son while wearing this vest though. When he's holding on to the edge of the pull or when he wants to kick on his belly, he topples and face plants in the water pretty easily. The vest immediately puts him back on his back again, but he usually gets a pretty big gulp of water first.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fake Sterns Life Jacket
customer_reviews.text: I read reviews about it may be a knock off and you can totally tell it’s a knock off. The Sterns.. “S” was sewn on the life jacket but the quality of it... You can tell was cheap. I would not trust my infant in this life jacket. The buckle and strap felt super cheap.. It could snap off. The buckle.. felt like a dollar store buckle. I knew there’s no way my infant would be protected wearing it in the water.
customer_reviews.author: ROSE T

customer_reviews.title: Kids don't float.
customer_reviews.text: The best thing! Baby automatically flips over. We literally use it in our pool. We are six inches from him of course but he just floats on his back like a prince on a pool raft. The construction is very good and the red color is beautiful. It does seam kind of tight and uncomfortable it first blush. I literally thought I had made a bad purchase but the kid wouldn't give it back so I let him use it. I'm glad I did. I didn't understand that the snug fit is what holds it in the correct position. He is 21 months old and 25lbs. We have used it for 3 months. I don't s
customer_reviews.author: Kdekreon

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this when our child was about 4 months old but didn’t use it since we hadn’t had a chance to be around water. It almost seemed like a waist of money... Then just a few weeks ago we were able to have a family vacation on a river. Brought the vest along, just in case. ;) we used it the whole time and super happy we had it!! Our child is nearly 2 now and it fit great! The handle at the head rest made it perfect to hold on to our child as we floated in the river!
customer_reviews.author: Cody&Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for. We have a pool and my 15 month old loves playing on the steps and being in the water, but doesn't like a baby tube/flotation device. This put him on his back when floating (it does not for all). We are (of course) right next to him in the pool but this gives him slightly more freedom to enjoy himself.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney T.

customer_reviews.title: This item does not work. It flipped my grandson ...
customer_reviews.text: This item does not work. It flipped my grandson over and his face went right in the water. This is not how a.life jacket is supposed to work! My return by date was June 6th. I am hoping to hear from someone offering a refund!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great value! Glad we had it on the boat
customer_reviews.text: We tried three different life jackets for my son. This one was the most comfortable for him and I preferred it to the Puddle Jumper in terms of life saving and my 19 month old didn’t want to even try swimming in the puddle jumper. He only wanted to wear this one. The other two life jackets we tried were more expensive and more uncomfortable for my son.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan Klein

customer_reviews.title: Met the requirement
customer_reviews.text: Trying to research which life jacket would be "perfect" for our grand daughter could've led to mental breakdown. At the end of the day I needed one that would meet the requirement of the law and prevent her from sinking in the case of a catastrophic emergency. This fit our 9 month 16 lb . GD just right. She wasn't entirely fond of it but again, this is a life saving device. Not meant for no comfort contest although she did sustain wearing it 2x for a combined 7 hours. I couldn't give it a 5 star since I wasn't able to test it's full potential.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Safe. Great quality. Good for safety.
customer_reviews.text: Fit well. We'll made. Worked great for a rafting trip with young children. Not as good for swimming pool though, just because there are more comfortable options like puddle jumpers. We didn't feel their puddle jumpers were a safe option for a rafting trip. This life vest was great, especially for its head rest which ensures your little one's head stays upright. We always supervise them closely in their puddle jumpers, but we needed something that could the kids safe even if they fell into the river.
customer_reviews.author: SeriousAboutShopping!

customer_reviews.title: Runs small!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product but it runs small. It says for up to 30lbs but when we tried to put it on my 20lb daughter it was way too tight, even for a life vest. It was too late to return it by the time we tried it on.
customer_reviews.author: JLQ

customer_reviews.title: I like this vest
customer_reviews.text: I like this vest, and I want to give it a higher star but the fit is a bit snug for my 20lbs five month old. He gets fussy if we put him in it. It works well keeping the head up out of water but water can still seep into his ears. With any water vest....always have supervision. There is a handle that works well also to grabbing. Here's a pic of my little one in it at the end of his bath, testing it out.
customer_reviews.author: Kelvin

customer_reviews.title: More toddler than infant-sized
customer_reviews.text: Product meets specifications and the color and everything is as expected. It's certainly not 0-12 months or under 30 pounds, though. I'd call it more 8-18 months and 25-35 pounds. It's really more toddler-sized than infant-sized. Although it's the smallest life vest that we've been able to find, so as long as we don't sink we're fine!
customer_reviews.author: Ainslie Schroeder

customer_reviews.title: It does its job!
customer_reviews.text: This vest i purchased for ym 11 month old son. He is 23 lbs and 31 inches. Now... it works great it kept him up and the back head piece is awesome to keep his head from going all the way under. but if your child does not have good balance on their feet they can fall face forward and not be able to lift there head up. It was my sons first time in the pool in Jamaica and it worked great!!! it kept him safe, it was secure the buckles worked, the material lasted.
customer_reviews.author: tanya

customer_reviews.title: used these for my grandsons canoe trip
customer_reviews.text: My grandson fell over in the water at the Saco and the vest righted him chest /head up immediately!!! Very safe
customer_reviews.author: sue haun

customer_reviews.title: When I received it I was amazed with the quality
customer_reviews.text: My grandson was about 18 month when I made this purchase. When I received it I was amazed with the quality. It fit all around his body but a bit to much under his chin. I can see using this vest for a few more years. I would purchase another one when needed.
customer_reviews.author: dvd dave

customer_reviews.title: Works great for the baby
customer_reviews.text: Works great for the baby. He's 10 months old and around 22 lbs. I am not sure it would fit well on a 30lb baby, though - so if your baby is closer to the top end of the weight limit, maybe try something for 30-50lbs instead?
customer_reviews.author: Kristi

customer_reviews.title: Does not say "US Coastguard approved".
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't find anything that said it was U.S. Coastguard approved. As far as I understand, this is something that is 100% necessary. I don't have time to send things back and will write this off as a waste of money...or maybe the older kids will have fun with it in the pool..
customer_reviews.author: JodiP

customer_reviews.title: A must have with an infant in the boat!!!
customer_reviews.text: We love this life jacket. Fits perfectly on our 4mo old grandson. We tested it in the pool and it works very good.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great vest. My son is 8 months old but ...
customer_reviews.text: Great vest. My son is 8 months old but large for his age, and the chest was definitely a good tight fit, as it should be. He was able to lay on his back in the water and float. Although in the pool the water did creep into his neck area and could have gotten in his mouth a little, if he were in choppy water. My daughter splashed near him and created waves in the pool and he did get a little water near his mouth. So, if you're on a boat, this vest may save your child's life but they may still swallow some water.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: Fit my 1 year old ok. He couldn’t sit down in our boat very well though. It would ride up his neck and irritate him if he sat down . The handle on it was great. I was able to nab him before he got too close to the water
customer_reviews.author: Desiree Marchant

customer_reviews.title: Works great for 4 month old
customer_reviews.text: We used this for our LO when he was 4 months old. It was super bulky for a baby that tiny but it kept him safe and adjusted down to the size we needed. I was able to breastfeed him while we were out on the wayer but it was NOT easy cause the bulk, but better safe then sorry
customer_reviews.author: Amanda A

customer_reviews.title: Just OK. Might want to try a different product though.
customer_reviews.text: Works well apart from the fact that the foam around the child's neck practically chokes them when in the water. Why not cut the foam down around the neck hole? The foam is waaay to thick in this area and could potentially be dangerous. Might have to make that modification myself and sew it back up. You can see in my picture that she's not even down in the water where it pushed up on her face and it's still smashing her checks and neck.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: More for toddlers than infants
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 14mo daughter but I don’t think she is big enough for it yet, it was not very comfortable for her. We ended up not even using it because it was choking her more than it was helping her float. I just think she doesn’t have enough room between her neck for the best to fit properly. I will definitely keep it and use it as she grows. It seems very sturdy and good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Alexa Moak

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my 1 1/2 year old
customer_reviews.text: We got this to use at the pool and beach so our toddler can be more independent and stay safe. When allowed to float naturally in this vest she turns onto her back with her face out of the water, which is a nice safe position if she were to fall into the water or get away from us at the pool. Gives me a lot of peace of mind as a parent.
customer_reviews.author: DJanss

customer_reviews.title: Great vest and a great price.
customer_reviews.text: Fits my 3 month old grand-daughter well and she didn't squawk at all the whole time we were out on the pontoon. The vest is made for infants up to 30 lbs, but I wouldn't put it on a newborn or child under 12 lbs. New babies' heads are so large compared to the rest of their body, I think the child might go face down in the water.
customer_reviews.author: TMS1950

customer_reviews.title: Works well, but so uncomfortable and awkward
customer_reviews.text: Obviously, it's a life jacket, so there isn't much to it, but you would think they could come up with a better design for a life-jacket for a baby. He was so uncomfortable and it was not great to put on. It works, it just isn't the best.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Langley

customer_reviews.title: Easier to find on Amazon than local stores
customer_reviews.text: Couldn’t find an infant vest locally and was so happy to get it in two days from Amazon. Easy to get on—used for my average-sized one-year-old to safety take boat rides on the lake. Baby hates getting it on and it’s boy comfortable to wear—but it keeps her safe and secure even if she goes for a swim.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: Great for small babies.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 10 month old son. My son is considered small for his age (just started wearing 6-9 month clothing), is 20lbs & this tightens up great on him. We haven't been out in the water yet to use it but I have no concerns with him slipping out of it. Great price too.
customer_reviews.author: Mama Row

customer_reviews.title: Will save you, but not easy to swim in
customer_reviews.text: Although this is a great device to have on child if they fall in pool....it is not good for swimming. Used on 2 year old that met weight requirements. It just keeps throwing her on her back. Toddlers are not strong enough to stay straight and play/swim.
customer_reviews.author: April Singleton

customer_reviews.title: Ok for 2 yo
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my two year old, she’s 33 inches & 23 lbs, so she’s too small for all of the 30-50 lb vests, so we ordered this. It fits her good & she seems to like it. My only complaint is the head piece is kind of tough in the pool, it automatically flips her on her back & she hates that. So we have to hold her. At least we know she’s safe.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer S

customer_reviews.title: So far she hates it
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised by how THICK the foam is on this life jacket. It's a good 1 3/4" thick. It is completely rigid and it's impossible for my 9 month old daughter to sit down in it because from lap to chin, it's just too big. It pushes her face up so she has to look at the sky and she just wails. This life jacket seems more intended for walkers all around. I saw a baby in a Stearns life jacket at the local pool and hers was much thinner and more comfortable looking. If you have a pre-walker, this jacket may not be for you.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer T.

customer_reviews.title: Very good product
customer_reviews.text: I used this for my daughter when she was only 3 months old at the lake and the pool and it held up nicely
customer_reviews.author: Pinkishpoogle

customer_reviews.title: Seems good
customer_reviews.text: We haven't tested to see if this helps our 18month old onto her back in the water but she wore it for 3 hours straight. She did seem more comfortable in the Airhead one we tried but we preferred the look of this one.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Not comfortable
customer_reviews.text: My 6 month old did not like this life jacket and screamed the entire time wearing it until we took it off of him. it was too big on him. He is 18-20 lbs. it was only $23 so I guess you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Brandi_G

customer_reviews.title: 11 month old did not mind it, I loved it!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for our trip to Lake Powell. My baby was 19lbs and 11 months old. This fit her perfectly. She didn't seem to mind it too bad either. It made her look like she had no neck but honestly it made for adorable pics! She even napped in this 3 times, so clearly it wasn't too uncomfortable!
customer_reviews.author: Miranda Wigner

customer_reviews.title: he's 30lb and fit him great also!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter hates bulky life jackets but was okay with this one. When we bought it she was 6 mon and 15 lbs. it was hard to find one to adjust to her size. My 3.5 y/o nephew wore it, he's 30lb and fit him great also!
customer_reviews.author: Robert larkin

customer_reviews.title: Decent
customer_reviews.text: I use this life jacket for my 7 month old. He wears it on the boat only and usually naps in it. Not comfortable enough to wear regularly. Could probably find a better life jacket but this serves its purpose and would trust it in an emergency.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My son was very comfortable in it and actually fell asleep a few times ...
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this life vest for a recent boating trip. My son was very comfortable in it and actually fell asleep a few times while wearing it. The stitching is very strong and the handle was handy for when he wanted to walk around the boat and we were worried he would fall over.
customer_reviews.author: nelliebutton

customer_reviews.title: Good price for occasional use for infants
customer_reviews.text: We purchased two of these for 8 month old twins for a family outing on a pontoon boat. The rental came with adult life vests but not infant ones. They were quite bulky so the babies didn't really like wearing them. I think if we were going to do a lot of boating, I would opt for something more comfortable but for the price, they were just what we needed.
customer_reviews.author: linda

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and well designed
customer_reviews.text: This float vest is perfect for my 2-year old son who wears it nearly every day in the pool. It gives him confidence in the water and develops his water and swimming skills. He likes to wear it and is comfortable in it. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: MR

customer_reviews.title: Safe!
customer_reviews.text: Not for swimming, more for safety. Would wear this for boating or kayaking. My 2 year old is too small (under 30 lb) for the puddle jumpers for learning how to swim so this is what we went with.
customer_reviews.author: Lyndsey Jennifer Joy Seppala

customer_reviews.title: Great, but Can unzip
customer_reviews.text: This works very well for my 16 month old. He easily floats on his back and likes it. The only thing I don’t like is that he can unzip it. The strap prevents him from unzipping completely, but he can still get it down more than he should.
customer_reviews.author: Brooke Stubbs

customer_reviews.title: Now he's a little bigger it should be fine. Looks great and seems to be a nice ...
customer_reviews.text: It's tough to find any life-jacket that fits a 2 month old, this was ok - it was clearly too big but just about bearable. Now he's a little bigger it should be fine. Looks great and seems to be a nice quality. Not sure it's really an 'infant' vest
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: Happy baby=Happy Mama
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my 1 year old son for our vacation. He weighs 20 lbs. and this fit him perfectly! Once received I put it on him to adjust the straps and test the fit. He loves it and wore it around the house while playing. I was relieved that he wasn’t fighting it and actually enjoyed wearing it. Great purchase. :)
customer_reviews.author: Bridget Pitchford

customer_reviews.title: We used this in the pool. This allowed my ...
customer_reviews.text: We used this in the pool. This allowed my daughter to keep her arms free. I could see this being an ideal choice for kids on boats. The large part behind the head makes it so the child stays face up. Makes it difficult for a kid just trying to float around in the pool since it kind of forces the kid to lay back.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No big complaints
customer_reviews.text: This jacket is bulky. My small, 13 month old, son was unsure of it. But, once he was in the water, he didn't seem to mind it. He floated comfortably on his back. And he was able to play while I held him.
customer_reviews.author: BusyMom83

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my 6 month old daughter who weighs about 16 pounds. It fits great. She doesn't love to wear it but I love having it. Well made and well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: angela

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Got it quickly and my little peanut LOVES it. I feel much more at ease now. I refuse to use anything but life jackets on my kids. I will update later once we use it if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Faith

customer_reviews.title: Works great for my 2 year old
customer_reviews.text: Works great for my 2 year old. Its easy to get on and off. Seems comfortable. My child is able to float upright. The vest normally turns him onto his back if he happens to be face down. I would recommend this vest for parents that plan to their kids on a boat.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is only 7lbs so it’s a bit big on her but she will grow into it. My biggest complaint is that the bottom strap buckle is not in line so the strap is crooked. It does come with all the coast guard info so it is coast guard approved.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: It is huge- super bulky and smashes over my baby's face and she ...
customer_reviews.text: Does the job, but 0-30 lb life jacket for a 13 lb baby is crazy. It is huge- super bulky and smashes over my baby's face and she can't move her arms in it. Thankfully she just fell asleep with it on.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Kept my little guy safe and afloat!
customer_reviews.text: Kept my almost 2 year old safe and afloat on the lake. Puts him onto his back if he wasn’t swimming which is exactly what I wanted to happen. Easy to put on and my son wore it all day with no complaints. I was at ease knowing he was comfortable and safe
customer_reviews.author: Bekki

customer_reviews.title: Safe but uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: Works well but unfortunately our daughter didn’t much care for it since it pushes up under her chin and appears uncomfortable when she’s sitting. But it kept her safe which is the most important part!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Fits great
customer_reviews.text: Got this for a new baby because a lot of the public pools we go to don't allow the floaties only life vest. He enjoys floating around the pool in his life vest and no worries or concerns about him sliding out of it!
customer_reviews.author: Russ

customer_reviews.title: Great for my 5 month old
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for taking my 5 month old swimming. He loves it. He just calmly floats on his back while wearing it. I would definitely trust it for boating with him. Based on the sizing it should still fit him next year too.
customer_reviews.author: elyse

customer_reviews.title: Great for babies✨
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item in case of emergency for a cruise trip. My son at the time was 6 month never quite used it till we went to a pool and the entire time he was enjoying it. He did swallow a little bit of water we paid attention to him because of the head rest. But it’s a great floaty for babies. Maybe not mine because he’s nosey and wanted to swim like everyone else but it did it’s job and the head rest was a great feature.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Pagan

customer_reviews.title: Great little life jacket
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is 2 and weighs about 23 lbs. this fits her well except for it being a little squished into her neck/chin. Otherwise a great little life jacket!
customer_reviews.author: JRubbo

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality.
customer_reviews.text: After the first time we used this with our 6 week old teeth starting coming out of the zipper! We have continued to use but have lost at least 5-10 teeth which makes it difficult to zip up and down. Disappointed and if I had know how poor the quality would be I would have picked a different one as now I have to buy a new one since she'll be less than 30 pounds for quite a while.
customer_reviews.author: C

customer_reviews.title: Acceptable
customer_reviews.text: I don’t think my kid was quite comfortable in it, he kind of had a look the whole time wearing it. I like how it is adjustable and does float well, so in another words, it does what it’s meant to do.

customer_reviews.title: He had to wear it for a recent trip to a water park and it must have been comfortable enough, because he didn't put up a fight ...
customer_reviews.text: My 2 year old is just under 30lbs and this fit him well. He had to wear it for a recent trip to a water park and it must have been comfortable enough, because he didn't put up a fight or try to take it off. That's saying a lot!!
customer_reviews.author: CTshopper

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: We love this vest, it is a little bulky and our son isn’t a huge fan of it but it is a great fit and we know it will work. We always bring when we go to the river, pools, or lake. Great purchase for the price!
customer_reviews.author: jessica povey

customer_reviews.title: for little ones may be tight onto fat cheeks
customer_reviews.text: love the color and material construction. However, when zipped up it crushes a 17 lb , 7 mo. old's cheeks, and no one happy with that. :-(
customer_reviews.author: Advid Tech User

customer_reviews.title: Excellent purchase and great price!
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with the quality and comfort. She automatically goes to her. A n in the water which is perfect. Fit is nice.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Mommy

customer_reviews.title: Only so-so...
customer_reviews.text: Kinda pricey for what you get and didn't do an A+ job keeping our little one face up...she still tended to flip quite a bit. It wasn't the game changer we were hoping for. Durable construction. Hoping it's more useful/effective once she gets a bit bigger. She's currently 24 lb.
customer_reviews.author: Ad n' Audie

customer_reviews.title: Great toddler vest
customer_reviews.text: We bought this vest for my 18 month old that weighs 29 lbs. So far it has been very sturdy, stayed in place, and proved itself very useful. He used it several times in the river next to our camp ground and seemed to feel completely secure with this vest on. He was able to rest partially on his back without tilting or flipping over. I would highly recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: Morgan

customer_reviews.title: ... two of these for my sons and they work great. The boys are both about 34 inches tall
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of these for my sons and they work great. The boys are both about 34 inches tall, 27lbs and still have some room to grow in them. They seem to be well built and would definitely keep a child on top of the water. One thing to note though is that kids can still spin themselves so they are face down in the water. The life jacket will push them back up but do not leave your child unattended thinking the vest will do everything (Common sense statement I know, but some people need to hear that).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE of GLOOUS
customer_reviews.text: Do not order from GLOOUS!!! This item is fraudulent. It is not a stearns as advertised. There is no USCG labeling. It has flotation material in the back part of the torso which causes the life jacket to flip the infant face down into the water!!!!!! This would DROWN a child not save them!!! The white “s” is a paper sticker that falls off immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Skiff

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for our new baby
customer_reviews.text: Bought for our new baby. She loves it (and the pool)! I love the handle at the top-makes for easy carrying and I can pull baby around the pool easily.
customer_reviews.author: Katie Bangerter

customer_reviews.title: Infant size does not fit infants
customer_reviews.text: Described as able to fit 16” chest or bigger and 0-30 pounds. Didn’t fit my 6mo, who has an 18” chest and weighs 14 lbs.
customer_reviews.author: TangerineLawBooks

customer_reviews.title: Safe and works well
customer_reviews.text: As with most infant life vests, the baby doesn't love wearing it, but she tolerates it well enough. I have also tried the kind with a single front piece and she seems to prefer this one. Fits nice and snug and gives me great comfort that she is safe while we are boating.
customer_reviews.author: Jollymama

customer_reviews.title: baby safe mother approved
customer_reviews.text: My 18month Old son loves this. He wore it the whole boat ride with no fuss. The vest has floats in the front and at the back of the head. No floats on the back I suppose that’s so they don’t roll onto there stomache. I feel this was a good buy for my baby.
customer_reviews.author: Noelle

customer_reviews.title: Fits great
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our 2yo for when go canoeing and it fit perfect. I love the handle on the back too because he likes to lean over the edge and splash the water and I can safely hold onto him in case he were to slip. He never seemed uncomfortable in it or cared that he had it on. He had a great time and stayed safe and thats the most important thing.
customer_reviews.author: Tori Sanders

customer_reviews.title: Works well, but not very soft
customer_reviews.text: We didn’t have any issues with it, my only complain is the rough material used. It might not be suitable for children with sensitive skin.

customer_reviews.title: Infant life vest.

customer_reviews.title: More versatile than expected.
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfectly with my grandson in boat. He was able to nap in it and formed a convenient bottle holder.

I bought this his first summer out and plan to continue to use it in the years to come. Sterns is a really great brand I plan to stick with them for life jacket needs!

customer_reviews.title: Great for the boat or the ocean
customer_reviews.text: This life jacket definitely runs big - it was a little uncomfortable for my daughter, but I didn't buy it for comfort. Luckily we didn't have to test the efficacy of the life jacket, but I trust it a lot more than her puddle jumpers.

customer_reviews.title: I would have liked it in a brighter color
customer_reviews.text: I would have liked it in a brighter color, or maybe with some reflector accents. However it fits really well and my kids seems as comfortable as they could be in a life jacket like this.

customer_reviews.text: I don’t recommend it at all. If child will turn on face to water in this jacket he / she will not be able to turn back . If child is On the back in jacket water goes in ears very easily. I am returning it . Not safe .

product_meta.title: Stearns Infant Classic Series Vest
product_meta.description: A Stearns Infant Classic Series Vest helps protect little swimmers at the beach or on the boat. The US Coast Guard-approved design is specially-fitted for infants under 30 lbs. A rescue handle allows adults to easily move the infant from the water or the boat, and it has one adjustable chest belt, a zipper and an adjustable leg strap for a tight and secure fit. Durable nylon construction and PE flotation foam, along with webbed straps, will allow you to use it season after season.
